Dear Mr. Gonzalez:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
5/14/2021. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Implementation
Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of
any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency was not required to submit any corrective action plans during this past
year.
The facility has not had any violations in several years. During interviews with staff,
they have adjusted well to COVID restrictions and staff feel supported by court
system.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
